msgSnippet: JUnit 4 seems to have removed the distinction between failures and errors. What s the thinking behind this? I always found it to be a useful distinction

Subject: Why no errors in JUnit 4?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=pXKKbPCEbgKabbIG5BNogAh6XCEb_G7gOSIba8g1VszeSkmy

JUnit 4 seems to have removed the distinction between failures and 
errors. What's the thinking behind this? I always found it to be a 
useful distinction myself.
